title: Ticket #5368: condor_transfer_data fails and causes schedd to except
description:
Due to same safeguards added in #4522, the SchedD will except when transferring data out to the condor_transfer_data tool.

Gory details: the problem is in BuildFileCatalog in the file transfer object, which hard-codes a parameter to the instantiation of a Directory object as PRIV_USER. This causes the Directory object to attempt to switch to user priv when iterating the contents of spool, which we don't want since user_privs have not been initted and spool is owned by the condor user anyway.

The reason this is a regression is that without this check, some warnings would get dprintf'ed into the log, but it was not fatal. The commits in #4522 change the failure semantics.

I could simply change the one call site that I'm aware of, but am uncertain we wouldn't be bitten again by a different use case. As such, my preference for 8.4.2 is to revert the change, going back to the same behavior as 8.4.0, and leave this alone for the stable series. We should put the EXCEPT back in and fix call sites in the dev series.
